questions.text: What does 'MCAR' stand for in the context of missing data?
questions.explanation: MCAR means Missing Completely At Random, implying the probability of missingness is unrelated to any observed or unobserved data.

questions.text: Which of the following are imputation methods for handling missing data? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Mean imputation and KNN imputation are methods of replacing missing values. Listwise deletion and dropping features are deletion methods.

questions.text: Mean imputation is generally more robust to outliers than median imputation.
questions.explanation: Median imputation is more robust to outliers because the median is less affected by extreme values than the mean.
